TASK_WAS_NOT_FOUND_IN_THE_PROJECT.message: Task %s was not found in the project %s. Invalid command to execute the build task, please verify the parameters in the command and try again.
solutions: Run 'hvigorw --help' to learn more about hvigor command.
Run 'hvigorw tasks' to get a list of available tasks.
Run the command with '--info' or '--debug' option to get more log output.

THE_REQUIRE_ATTRIBUTE_MODULE_NAME_IS_MIS.message: The required attribute: module-name is missing
solutions: Access the build-profile.json5 file in the project root directory and make sure the name field exists under modules.
Access the configuration file of the module dynamically added in the hvigorconfig.ts file in the project root directory, and make sure the name field exists.

THE_REQUIRE_ATTRIBUTE_MODULE_SRCPATH_IS_.message: The required attribute module-srcPath is missing
solutions: Access the build-profile.json5 file in the project root directory and make sure the srcPath field exists under modules.
Access the configuration file of the module dynamically added in the hvigorconfig.ts file in the project root directory, and make sure the srcPath field exists.

THE_SRCPATH_IS_NOT_A_RELATIVE_PATH.message: The srcPath is not a relative path: %s
solutions: Make sure the srcPath in the hvigorconfig.ts file of the project is a relative path.

METHID_SETPROPERTY_VALIDATE_FAILED_IN_HV.message: Method setProperty validate failed in hvigorfile.ts.

solutions: Check the Node.js version corresponding to NODE_HOME in the current environment. It is recommended to use the bundled Node.js from the command-line tool or IDE.
